column1: #Text=Bengali ( Bangla / বাংলা ) is the sole official language of Bangladesh , and one of the 22 official languages of India .

#Text=It is spoken as a first language by the majority of the population in Bangladesh , as well as people in the Indian state of West Bengal , which includes Kolkata ( Calcutta ) , India 's third largest city .
#Text=It is the sixth most spoken language in the world .
#Text=The following is a sample text in Bengali of the Article 1 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights ( by the United Nations ) :
#Text=ধারা ১ : সমস্ত মানুষ স্বাধীনভাবে সমান মর্যাদা এবং অধিকার নিয়ে জন্মগ্রহণ করে। তাঁদের বিবেক এবং বুদ্ধি আছে ; সুতরাং সকলেরই একে অপরের প্রতি ভ্রাতৃত্বসুলভ মনোভাব নিয়ে আচরণ করা উচিৎ।
#Text=Dhara êk : Shômosto manush shadhinbhabe shôman môrjada ebong odhikar nie jônmogrohon kôre .
#Text=buddhi achhe ; shutorang shôkoleri êke ôporer proti bhrattrittoshulôbh mônobhab nie achorôn kôra uchit .
#Text=— Bengali in transcription , faithful to pronunciation .
#Text=Clause 1 : All human free-manner-in equal dignity and right taken birth-take do .
#Text=Their reason and intelligence is ; therefore everyone-indeed one another 's towards brotherhood-ly attitude taken conduct do should .
#Text=Article 1 : All human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights .
#Text=They are endowed with reason and conscience .
#Text=Therefore , they should act towards one another in a spirit of brotherhood .
#Text=The phoneme inventory of Bengali consists of 29 consonants and 14 vowels , including the seven nasalized vowels .
#Text=Vowel sounds can either be independent or hooked on to the consonant in the form of diacritics .
#Text=The independent vowel is on the left , the diacritic ( which is hooked on to the consonant ) is on the right .
#Text=র : Like " r " in " run " , but slightly trilled ( r ) .

column1: #Text=Retroflex consonants are pronounced with the tip of the tongue flapping against the roof of the mouth .
#Text=ড : Like " d " in " doubt " but retroflex ( đ ) .
#Text=ড় : Like " r " in " run " but slightly trilled retroflex ( ŗ ) .
#Text=ত : Like " t " in " talk " but retroflex ( ţ ) .
#Text=Aspirated retroflex consonants are pronounced with the tip of the tongue flapping against the roof of the mouth and a puff of air .
#Text=ঢ : Like " d " in " din " but retroflex ( đ ' ) .
#Text=Like " t " in " tin " but retroflex ( ţ ' ) .
#Text=I ca n't speak [ name of language ] ( that well ) .
#Text=Is there someone here who speaks English ?
#Text=In everyday life , most Bangladeshi use the Gregorian Calendar .
